channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Diagnosis and Prognosis of Faults in High-Speed Aeronautical Bearings with a Collaborative Selection Incremental Deep Transfer Learning Approach
item.description: The diagnosis and prognosis of aeronautical-bearing health conditions are essential to proactively ensuring efficient power transmission, safety, and reduced downtime.

item.title: Multi-task View Synthesis with Neural Radiance Fields
item.description: To tackle the MTVS problem, we propose MuvieNeRF, a framework that incorporates both multi-task and cross-view knowledge to simultaneously synthesize multiple scene properties.

item.title: EGVD: Event-Guided Video Deraining
item.description: In this paper, we approach video deraining by employing an event camera.

item.title: ComSD: Balancing Behavioral Quality and Diversity in Unsupervised Skill Discovery
item.description: Ideal unsupervised skill discovery methods are able to produce diverse and qualified skills in the absence of extrinsic reward, while the discovered skill set can efficiently adapt to downstream tasks in various ways.

item.title: Revisiting Cephalometric Landmark Detection from the view of Human Pose Estimation with Lightweight Super-Resolution Head
item.description: Accurate localization of cephalometric landmarks holds great importance in the fields of orthodontics and orthognathics due to its potential for automating key point labeling.

item.title: Segment Anything Model is a Good Teacher for Local Feature Learning
item.description: To do so, first, we construct an auxiliary task of Pixel Semantic Relational Distillation (PSRD), which distillates feature relations with category-agnostic semantic information learned by the SAM encoder into a local feature learning network, to improve local feature description using semantic discrimination.

item.title: Networked Inequality: Preferential Attachment Bias in Graph Neural Network Link Prediction
item.description: We further bridge GCN's preferential attachment bias with unfairness in link prediction and propose a new within-group fairness metric.

item.title: AutoAgents: A Framework for Automatic Agent Generation
item.description: Therefore, we introduce AutoAgents, an innovative framework that adaptively generates and coordinates multiple specialized agents to build an AI team according to different tasks.

item.title: Towards a Unified Framework for Adaptable Problematic Content Detection via Continual Learning
item.description: Detecting problematic content, such as hate speech, is a multifaceted and ever-changing task, influenced by social dynamics, user populations, diversity of sources, and evolving language.

item.title: Beyond Co-occurrence: Multi-modal Session-based Recommendation
item.description: (2) How to fuse these heterogeneous descriptive information to comprehensively infer user interests?

item.title: Interpretable Long-Form Legal Question Answering with Retrieval-Augmented Large Language Models
item.description: To support this approach, we introduce and release the Long-form Legal Question Answering (LLeQA) dataset, comprising 1, 868 expert-annotated legal questions in the French language, complete with detailed answers rooted in pertinent legal provisions.

item.title: Guiding Instruction-based Image Editing via Multimodal Large Language Models
item.description: Extensive experimental results demonstrate that expressive instructions are crucial to instruction-based image editing, and our MGIE can lead to a notable improvement in automatic metrics and human evaluation while maintaining competitive inference efficiency.

item.title: I Wish to Have an Argument: Argumentative Reasoning in Large Language Models
item.description: We frame our experiments in terms of the argument mining (AM) and argument pair extraction (APE) tasks, and evaluate their ability to perform reasoning at increasing levels of abstraction in the input and output representations (e. g., arbitrary label sets, semantic graphs).

item.title: SegRCDB: Semantic Segmentation via Formula-Driven Supervised Learning
item.description: SegRCDB has a high potential to contribute to semantic segmentation pre-training and investigation by enabling the creation of large datasets without manual annotation.

item.title: A Survey of Incremental Transfer Learning: Combining Peer-to-Peer Federated Learning and Domain Incremental Learning for Multicenter Collaboration
item.description: Incremental transfer learning, which combines peer-to-peer federated learning and domain incremental learning, can overcome the data privacy issue and meanwhile preserve model performance by using continual learning techniques.

item.title: When Epipolar Constraint Meets Non-local Operators in Multi-View Stereo
item.description: This constraint reduces the 2D search space into the epipolar line in stereo matching.

item.title: Information Flow in Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: In this paper, we provide a comprehensive toolbox for understanding and enhancing self-supervised learning (SSL) methods through the lens of matrix information theory.

item.title: Multi-Depth Branches Network for Efficient Image Super-Resolution
item.description: Transformer-based SR methods, while incorporating global structural details, frequently come with an abundance of parameters, leading to high computational overhead.

item.title: SCALE: Synergized Collaboration of Asymmetric Language Translation Engines
item.description: In this paper, we introduce SCALE, a collaborative framework that connects compact Specialized Translation Models (STMs) and general-purpose Large Language Models (LLMs) as one unified translation engine.

item.title: Promoting Generalized Cross-lingual Question Answering in Few-resource Scenarios via Self-knowledge Distillation
item.description: Our approach seeks to enhance cross-lingual QA transfer using a high-performing multilingual model trained on a large-scale dataset, complemented by a few thousand aligned QA examples across languages.

item.title: Too Big, so Fail? -- Enabling Neural Construction Methods to Solve Large-Scale Routing Problems
item.description: In recent years new deep learning approaches to solve combinatorial optimization problems, in particular NP-hard Vehicle Routing Problems (VRP), have been proposed.

item.title: Memory Gym: Partially Observable Challenges to Memory-Based Agents in Endless Episodes
item.description: It features partially observable 2D environments with discrete controls, namely Mortar Mayhem, Mystery Path, and Searing Spotlights.

item.title: Suspicion-Agent: Playing Imperfect Information Games with Theory of Mind Aware GPT4
item.description: Unlike perfect information games, where all elements are known to every player, imperfect information games emulate the real-world complexities of decision-making under uncertain or incomplete information.

item.title: Can Sensitive Information Be Deleted From LLMs? Objectives for Defending Against Extraction Attacks
item.description: Experimentally, we show that even state-of-the-art model editing methods such as ROME struggle to truly delete factual information from models like GPT-J, as our whitebox and blackbox attacks can recover "deleted" information from an edited model 38% of the time.

item.title: Redistributing the Precision and Content in 3D-LUT-based Inverse Tone-mapping for HDR/WCG Display
item.description: The latter requires more efficiency, thus the pre-calculated LUT (look-up table) has become a popular solution.

item.title: GRANDE: Gradient-Based Decision Tree Ensembles
item.description: Despite the success of deep learning for text and image data, tree-based ensemble models are still state-of-the-art for machine learning with heterogeneous tabular data.

item.title: Investigating Shift Equivalence of Convolutional Neural Networks in Industrial Defect Segmentation
item.description: In industrial defect segmentation tasks, while pixel accuracy and Intersection over Union (IoU) are commonly employed metrics to assess segmentation performance, the output consistency (also referred to equivalence) of the model is often overlooked.

item.title: From Empirical Measurements to Augmented Data Rates: A Machine Learning Approach for MCS Adaptation in Sidelink Communication
item.description: In this paper, we propose a machine learning approach to predict suitable MCS levels.

item.title: Towards Free Data Selection with General-Purpose Models
item.description: However, current approaches, represented by active learning methods, typically follow a cumbersome pipeline that iterates the time-consuming model training and batch data selection repeatedly.

item.title: Efficient Streaming Language Models with Attention Sinks
item.description: In this paper, we first demonstrate that the emergence of attention sink is due to the strong attention scores towards initial tokens as a ``sink'' even if they are not semantically important.

item.title: G4SATBench: Benchmarking and Advancing SAT Solving with Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Graph neural networks (GNNs) have recently emerged as a promising approach for solving the Boolean Satisfiability Problem (SAT), offering potential alternatives to traditional backtracking or local search SAT solvers.

item.title: Deep Representation Learning for Prediction of Temporal Event Sets in the Continuous Time Domain
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first work that solves the problem of predicting event set intensities in the continuous time domain by using TPPs.

item.title: nnSAM: Plug-and-play Segment Anything Model Improves nnUNet Performance
item.description: The recent developments of foundation models in computer vision, especially the Segment Anything Model (SAM), allow scalable and domain-agnostic image segmentation to serve as a general-purpose segmentation tool.

item.title: Utility-based Adaptive Teaching Strategies using Bayesian Theory of Mind
item.description: To this end, human teachers seem to build mental models of the learner's internal state, a capacity known as Theory of Mind (ToM).

item.title: ToRA: A Tool-Integrated Reasoning Agent for Mathematical Problem Solving
item.description: Large language models have made significant progress in various language tasks, yet they still struggle with complex mathematics.

item.title: Text-to-3D using Gaussian Splatting
item.description: In this stage, we increase the number of Gaussians by compactness-based densification to enhance continuity and improve fidelity.

item.title: Demystifying CLIP Data
item.description: We believe that the main ingredient to the success of CLIP is its data and not the model architecture or pre-training objective.

item.title: QonFusion -- Quantum Approaches to Gaussian Random Variables: Applications in Stable Diffusion and Brownian Motion
item.description: The principal theme of our research is the incorporation of Quantum Random Number Generators (QRNGs) into classical models of diffusion.

item.title: Diverse and Aligned Audio-to-Video Generation via Text-to-Video Model Adaptation
item.description: The proposed method is based on a lightweight adaptor network, which learns to map the audio-based representation to the input representation expected by the text-to-video generation model.

item.title: Qwen Technical Report
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have revolutionized the field of artificial intelligence, enabling natural language processing tasks that were previously thought to be exclusive to humans.

item.title: Deep Geometrized Cartoon Line Inbetweening
item.description: To preserve the precision and detail of the line drawings, we propose a new approach, AnimeInbet, which geometrizes raster line drawings into graphs of endpoints and reframes the inbetweening task as a graph fusion problem with vertex repositioning.

item.title: Transformer-VQ: Linear-Time Transformers via Vector Quantization
item.description: We introduce Transformer-VQ, a decoder-only transformer computing softmax-based dense self-attention in linear time.

item.title: HTC-DC Net: Monocular Height Estimation from Single Remote Sensing Images
item.description: To tackle this problem, we propose a method for monocular height estimation from optical imagery, which is currently one of the richest sources of remote sensing data.

item.title: On the Contractivity of Plug-and-Play Operators
item.description: The present work is motivated by the following questions: Can we relax the assumptions on the forward model?

item.title: Improving Equivariance in State-of-the-Art Supervised Depth and Normal Predictors
item.description: Dense depth and surface normal predictors should possess the equivariant property to cropping-and-resizing -- cropping the input image should result in cropping the same output image.

item.title: Beyond Citations: Text-Based Metrics for Assessing Novelty and its Impact in Scientific Publications
item.description: Our findings support the use of text mining both to measure novel scientific ideas at the time of publication and to measure the impact of these new ideas on later scientific work.

item.title: On the Challenges of Fully Incremental Neural Dependency Parsing
item.description: Since the popularization of BiLSTMs and Transformer-based bidirectional encoders, state-of-the-art syntactic parsers have lacked incrementality, requiring access to the whole sentence and deviating from human language processing.

item.title: Decoding the Workplace & EOR: An Employee Survey Analysis by Data Science Techniques and Visualization
item.description: This research study explores the new dynamics of employee-organi-zation relationships (EOR) [6] using advanced data science methodologies and presents findings through accessible visualizations.

item.title: LagrangeBench: A Lagrangian Fluid Mechanics Benchmarking Suite
item.description: Machine learning has been successfully applied to grid-based PDE modeling in various scientific applications.

item.title: Hallucination Reduction in Long Input Text Summarization
item.description: We have used the following metrics to measure factual consistency at the entity level: precision-source, and F1-target.
